meanings.sent1: She added a tads of sugar to her tea.
meanings.sent2: He only needed a tads of paint to finish the project.
meanings.sent3: The recipe called for a tads of salt, but she accidentally poured in a whole cup!
meanings.sent4: His savings increased by tads each month, slowly but steadily.
meanings.sent5: The tiny bird chirped happily, pecking at tads of seeds on the ground.

meanings.sent1: The tads played together in the park.
meanings.sent2: She watched over the group of tads as they ran around the playground.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous tads giggled as they plotted a prank on their teacher.
meanings.sent4: The tads' laughter filled the room, bringing joy to all who heard.
meanings.sent5: The little tads held hands, forming a line as they walked to the classroom.

meanings.definition: A small amount of a liquid, especially one used in dyeing or chemical analysis.
meanings.sent1: The scientist carefully measured a tads of the solution for the experiment.
meanings.sent2: She poured a tads of dye into the fabric to create a beautiful pattern.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy assistant spilled a tads of the chemical, causing a colorful reaction.
meanings.sent4: The artist mixed tads of different paints to achieve the perfect shade.
meanings.sent5: The tiny vial contained only a tads of the precious liquid, just enough for the test.
